episode_summary: A Boxing Day year-in-review special with guest clips: Dan, Andy, and James share standout 2024 news items, including a study showing who laughs most at dad jokes, a Lake District DJ’s 24-hour ‘number two’ chart protest against sewage, Team GB’s canoe polo bronze powered by four McCutchen brothers, and the discovery that the famous “You wouldn’t steal a car” anti-piracy advert used a pirated font. The trio also riff on related science, protests, sport, and music oddities before swapping Christmas presents.

facts.fact: The people who find dad jokes the funniest are, in fact, dads.
I'm the presenter on Lake District Radio who played a marathon 24 hour show of number two records to highlight the real number two problem, sewage in our lakes and waterways.
The answer is we're part of the British canoe follow team who won bronze at this year's World Games in Chengdu.
I designed a font called FF Confidential. This year, an investigation found that the font seems to have been pirated and used in a very famous advert saying you wouldn't steal a car.
